thread.title: Aretha Franklin sings praises of Illinois after highway help
thread.title_full: Aretha Franklin sings praises of Illinois after highway help

author: CARLA K. JOHNSON
title: Aretha Franklin sings praises of Illinois after highway help
text:
Aretha Franklin sings praises of Illinois after highway help Originally published July 6, 2015 at 12:49 pm Updated July 6, 2015 at 2:11 pm FILE – In a March 4, 2015, file photo, singer Aretha Franklin is interviewed after a taping for American Idol XIV at The Fillmore Detroit. A spokesman for Franklin said Monday, July 6, 2015, says the Queen of Soul is grateful to the state of Illinois for its help when her tour bus broke down on the way to Chicago. Transmission problems stopped the bus around 1:20 a.m. Monday a few miles from downtown. (AP Photo/Carlos Osorio, File) By CARLA K. JOHNSON The Associated Press 
CHICAGO (AP) — Aretha Franklin’s spokesman said the Queen of Soul was grateful and exclaimed “Hallelujah!” after the state of Illinois helped out when her tour bus broke down on the way to Chicago and left her stranded along a highway. 
Transmission problems stopped the bus around 1:20 a.m. Monday a few miles from downtown on eastbound Interstate 290. Franklin’s assistants started calling car services to transport her from the side of the road, but they had no luck. 
“All were closed or had no vehicles because of the late hour and the holiday weekend,” Franklin spokesman Clarence Waldron said. 
That’s when the Illinois State Police stepped in. Most Read Stories
